oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Items related to the surender of Vicksburg
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Framed items include three chips from the oak tree where the surrender of Vicksburg was signed a 19th century newspaper article about the tree and a period newspaper article containing the text of Admiral David Porter's dispatch on the city's surrender. Porter, aboard the flagship USS Black Hawk, addressed the dispatch to Secretary of the Navy Gideon Welles. Label notes the three items are from the collection of John S. Reigert.
